content.description: This route starts after about a 15 foot scramble up some large blocks. It is short, steep, and well protected. Some feel the crux is in the lower steep section and others think it is the upper section between bolts 5, 6, and 7. Did I say well protected, I meant over bolted...be careful not to z-clip through the lower section of this climb.
content.protection: 7 bolts to chains, almost too many. The best protected route in the area.
content.location: Easy to find - just look for an obscene amount of bolts!

content.description: The crux is a big bulge at the top.
content.protection:
6 bolts to chains.  Well placed bolt at the crux.

This route (minus the bulge) can be TR'd from Bushwhacker with extra long slings.

content.description: Possibly one of the best 10s in the area. The climb starts after a 20-25 foot scramble up a series of blocks at which point you can clip the first bolt. Climb through four more bolts and encounter a bulgy crux well above the last bolt. Pull the bulge to a three bolt anchor with chains.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 3 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Just to the left of epic for the masses.  The second set of bolts west of The Populace Wall. Just around the corner from Mean Adene

content.description: If you know your plant names, you won't be too surprised to find some poison ivy at the base of this route. It's easy to avoid though. Start on a column top in a dihedral, enjoy the small cracks on both sides, and clip a bolt at the bulge and enjoy the fun climbing to the chains.
content.protection: Small gear and one bolt. 0.3 camalot/blue metolius size cams fit great, I've led it on 3 0.3's and a draw for the bolt. There are a few good small nut placements too.
content.location: Look for one bolt on a bulge near the top of a dihedral. Poison ivy at the base of the dihedral.

content.description: Climb standard Black Cliffs dihedral/stemming up towards a bulge. Clip the last bolt as you size up the bulge and then commit. The holds over the bulge are surprisingly good but you will struggle to find the feet you need to get the send. Mantle over the bulge and clip the chains. Super fun!
content.location: Lies between the popular routes Rhus Radicans and Bryan's Route. Has a high first bolt, next to a bush growing out of the wall.  The four bolts are also on alternate columns. See picture.

content.description: This route ascends a very obvious dihedral. Decent gear placements, with a lot of stemming moves. Near the top, the route overhangs, and the crux is pulling a move over the 'beak' to top out.
content.protection: single rack .4 to 1 BD camalots. A smaller cam and an extra #1 are helpful. The wide crack on the left will take a #3 higher up.
content.location: Located 40-50 feet left of the bolt line for Stone Tools.

content.description: Crux is an undercling/finger crack over a bulge at the top to the chains.  The start is a fun offwidth.
content.protection: 5 bolts to chains, but this route was originally a trad route and would take small pro.
content.location: Just to the right of Stone Tools.

content.description: Plenty of holds, some gardening needed.  No poison ivy on route, but some near by, so be wary.
content.location: To the right of Sweet Thing.

content.description: The crux is the last several moves before the chains.

Standard Black Cliff's broken jugs and side pulls lead you into a corner where you can clip the last bolt. From here, you need to transition to slab (crux) and make a few delicate moves to clip the chains.
